intro: Vaughania depauperata, commonly known as the poorleaf vaughania, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to Central America and parts of South America. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually oval to elliptic in shape. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Vaughania depauperata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests and along stream banks.
